entry.content:
In abortion debate I see that number of elective abortions that a woman could have during her lifetime is somehow left out of the discourse. But it is an important variable. And probably a potent line of attack for the right. I feel that the left will be easily baited in not putting an upper bound and the extreme right is already at 0 so it is already priced in so to say.
Btw my google fu seems to have failed me since I didn't manage to find a graph for distribution per number of abortions per woman for women that get them. If there happens to be a cohort of women with quite high number - this could make them a very soft and hard to defend target.
For me - the max number should be around 2-3 so women can have out in a critical periods of their life - "I was young and stupid", "I am too old for that shit", "The universe really hates me, just not now"
